storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant work periods

testCases.title: Validate shift type filtering functionality
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has multiple shifts assigned with different shift types (Morning, Evening, Night)
Application is accessible and running
Test data includes at least 3 morning shifts, 2 evening shifts, and 2 night shifts for the employee

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard/home page

steps.action: Click on the Schedule section/menu item from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads and displays all shifts for the employee across all shift types (Morning, Evening, Night) with complete shift details including date, time, and shift type

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter dropdown/selector and click to expand the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Filter dropdown opens showing all available shift type options (Morning, Evening, Night)

steps.action: Select 'Morning' from the shift type filter options
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display only morning shifts. All evening and night shifts are hidden. The filter indicator shows 'Morning' is selected. Shift count reflects only morning shifts

steps.action: Verify the filtered results by checking each displayed shift has shift type 'Morning'
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts show 'Morning' as the shift type. No evening or night shifts are visible in the schedule view

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filter' button or deselect the 'Morning' filter option
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed and the full schedule is displayed again showing all shift types (Morning, Evening, Night). All previously hidden shifts are now visible

steps.action: Verify the schedule displays all shifts across all shift types
steps.expectedResult: Complete schedule is visible with all morning, evening, and night shifts displayed as before filtering was applied

postconditions: System is ready for next operation

testCases.title: Ensure filter state persistence during navigation
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has shifts assigned with multiple shift types
Application is accessible and running
Employee is not currently logged in
Multiple schedule views are available (e.g., weekly view, monthly view, list view)

steps.action: Login to the application with valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and is redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads displaying all shifts without any filters applied

steps.action: Apply a shift type filter by selecting 'Evening' from the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates within 2 seconds to show only evening shifts. Filter indicator displays 'Evening' as active filter

steps.action: Navigate to a different schedule view (e.g., from weekly view to monthly view) within the schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view changes to the selected view type (monthly view) and the 'Evening' filter remains applied. Only evening shifts are displayed in the new view

steps.action: Navigate back to the original schedule view (weekly view)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule returns to weekly view with the 'Evening' filter still active. Only evening shifts are displayed. Filter state is maintained

steps.action: Navigate to another section of the application (e.g., Profile or Dashboard) and then return to the Schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Upon returning to Schedule section, the 'Evening' filter remains applied and only evening shifts are displayed

steps.action: Click the Logout button to log out of the application
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page. Session is terminated

steps.action: Login again with the same employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and is redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Schedule section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads with no filters applied (default state). All shifts across all shift types are displayed. Previous session's filter settings are not persisted

postconditions: No filters are active after fresh login

testCases.title: Verify unauthorized access is blocked
preconditions: Application is accessible and running
User is not logged in (no active session)
Direct URL to schedule filtering page is known
Authentication mechanism is enabled

steps.action: Open a web browser and ensure no user is currently logged into the application (clear cookies/session if needed)
steps.expectedResult: Browser opens with no active session. User is in logged-out state

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the schedule filtering page by entering the schedule URL (e.g., /schedule or /employee/schedule) in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. User is automatically redirected to the login page with a message indicating authentication is required

steps.action: Verify the current page is the login page and the schedule content is not accessible
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed. Schedule filtering functionality and schedule data are not visible or accessible. URL may show login page or redirect parameter

steps.action: Attempt to access the schedule API endpoint directly (GET /api/schedules?employeeId={id}&shiftType={type}) without authentication token using a REST client or browser
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code. No schedule data is returned. Error message indicates authentication is required

postconditions: User is on the login page

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to find specific shifts quickly

testCases.title: Validate schedule search by valid date
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has shifts scheduled on specific dates (e.g., shifts on 2024-01-15 and 2024-01-20)
Application is accessible and running
Date picker/search functionality is enabled
Test data includes at least 2 shifts on the target search date

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid employee credentials, then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Schedule section from the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads displaying the default schedule view (full schedule or current week/month)

steps.action: Locate the schedule search interface with date picker/input field
steps.expectedResult: Search interface is visible and accessible. Date input field or date picker is displayed and enabled for interaction

steps.action: Click on the date input field to activate the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date picker calendar opens showing current month with selectable dates

steps.action: Enter or select a valid date that has scheduled shifts (e.g., '2024-01-15' or select January 15, 2024 from the calendar)
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is populated in the date input field in the correct format (YYYY-MM-DD or configured format)

steps.action: Click the Search button or press Enter to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search executes and results load within 2 seconds. Schedule view updates to display only shifts scheduled for the selected date (2024-01-15). All shifts shown have the matching date. Shift details include time, shift type, and location

steps.action: Verify the displayed shifts match the searched date by checking the date field on each shift
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts show the searched date (2024-01-15). No shifts from other dates are visible. Shift count matches expected number of shifts for that date

steps.action: Clear the search input by clicking the Clear button or deleting the date from the input field
steps.expectedResult: Date input field is cleared and empty. Schedule view automatically restores to the default view showing the full schedule or current period. All shifts are visible again

steps.action: Verify the schedule displays the default view with all shifts
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed with shifts from multiple dates visible as before the search was performed

postconditions: System is ready for next search operation

testCases.title: Verify handling of invalid date input
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has navigated to the Schedule section
Schedule search interface is accessible
Test data includes dates with no scheduled shifts

steps.action: Locate the date search input field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Date search input field is visible and ready for input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format in the date input field (e.g., '2023-13-01' which has invalid month 13)
steps.expectedResult: Date input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Click the Search button or press Enter to attempt the search
steps.expectedResult: Search is blocked and not executed. An inline error message is displayed near the date input field stating 'Invalid date format. Please enter a valid date (YYYY-MM-DD)' or similar message. Schedule view remains unchanged

steps.action: Clear the invalid date and enter another invalid format (e.g., '32/01/2024' with invalid day)
steps.expectedResult: Date input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Attempt to search with the invalid date
steps.expectedResult: Search is blocked. Inline error message is displayed indicating invalid date format. No API call is made. Schedule remains unchanged

steps.action: Clear the error and enter a valid date format for a date that has no scheduled shifts (e.g., '2024-12-25' assuming no shifts on this date)
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and populated in the input field. No validation error is shown

steps.action: Click the Search button to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search executes successfully within 2 seconds. A user-friendly message is displayed stating 'No shifts found for the selected date' or 'You have no shifts scheduled on 2024-12-25'. The message is clearly visible and non-technical

steps.action: Verify the schedule view shows the no-results message and no shift data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule area displays the no-results message. No shift cards or entries are shown. The interface remains functional and does not show any error states

steps.action: Clear the search to return to the default schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Search is cleared and full schedule is restored with all shifts visible

postconditions: Schedule displays default view after clearing search
System is ready for valid search operations

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot perform schedule search
preconditions: Application is accessible and running
User is not logged in (no active session)
Direct URL to schedule search page is known
Authentication mechanism is enabled and enforced

steps.action: Open a web browser and ensure no user is currently logged into the application (clear all cookies and session data)
steps.expectedResult: Browser opens with clean state. No active user session exists

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the schedule search page by entering the schedule URL (e.g., /schedule or /employee/schedule/search) in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. User is automatically redirected to the login page. A message may be displayed indicating 'Please log in to access this page' or similar authentication required message

steps.action: Verify the current page is the login page and schedule search functionality is not accessible
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields. Schedule search interface is not visible. No schedule data is displayed. URL shows login page path

steps.action: Attempt to access the schedule search API endpoint directly (GET /api/schedules?employeeId={id}&date={date}) without authentication token using a REST client, Postman, or browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: API request is rejected. Response returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden HTTP status code. Response body contains error message such as 'Authentication required' or 'Unauthorized access'. No schedule data is returned in the response

steps.action: Verify no sensitive data is exposed in the error response
steps.expectedResult: Error response does not contain any schedule data, employee information, or system details. Only generic authentication error message is provided

postconditions: No schedule data is exposed or accessible
User is on the login page
System security and data protection is maintained
